comments:
If a project is configured to be publish to a server and the project is deleted, FlexibleProjectUtils throws a null pointer exception. May be duplicate of 156567

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.atf.project.FlexibleProjectUtils.getWebContentFolder(FlexibleProjectUtils.java:108)
	at org.eclipse.atf.server.http.core.HttpServerBehaviour.publish(HttpServerBehaviour.java:152)
	at org.eclipse.atf.server.http.core.HttpServerBehaviour.publishModule(HttpServerBehaviour.java:170)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publishModule(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:672)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publishModules(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:752)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.model.ServerBehaviourDelegate.publish(ServerBehaviourDelegate.java:610)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.doPublish(Server.java:803)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.publish(Server.java:791)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.PublishServerJob.run(PublishServerJob.java:145)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Similar to bug 156567 but in another method, a check is needed for when a project is null and publish is called. Also the publish is being called to deleted projects which is due to an empty override of a method from ServerBehaviourDelegate.
